humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor size is 2.8 cm, which falls within the range for a T2 tumor (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). There is no indication in the report that the tumor has direct extension to the chest wall or skin, so it is not a T4 tumor. Therefore, the predicted T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is stated as 'Greatest dimension: 2.8 cm'. According to the TNM staging system, a tumor size of greater than 2.0 cm but not more than 5.0 cm in greatest dimension corresponds to a T2 stage.
